com.teamviewer.sdk.screensharing.api

Interface TVSession


  • public interface TVSession
    Represents a session created with TVSessionFactory.createTVSession(Activity, String, TVSessionCreationCallback) and provides operations on it.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void setTVSessionCallback(TVSessionCallback sessionCallback)
      Registers a callback for events that can happen during a session.
      void start(TVSessionConfiguration sessionConfiguration)
      Establish a session over the TeamViewer network.
      void stop()
      Stops the session, if it is currently running.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        void start(TVSessionConfiguration sessionConfiguration)
           throws IllegalArgumentException
        Establish a session over the TeamViewer network. Depending on the supplied configuration either a new service case will be created or an existing session code will be used for the session.

        To get informed about events that will occur during the session, set a callback via setTVSessionCallback(TVSessionCallback) before invoking this method.

        Subsequent calls on the same object will have no effect.

        Parameters:
        sessionConfiguration - A configuration object.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If configuration object is null.

      • stop

        void stop()
        Stops the session, if it is currently running. You may use this to cancel a running session in response to events happening in your app. The currently running session can be obtained by calling TVSessionFactory#getRunningTVSession().

        Subsequent calls on the same object or calls on an already stopped session will have no effect.

      • setTVSessionCallback

        void setTVSessionCallback(TVSessionCallback sessionCallback)
        Registers a callback for events that can happen during a session. Implement the callback, if you want to react to events like updating your app's ui after the session ended.
        The callback will be executed on the main thread.
        Parameters:
        sessionCallback - An implementation of the TVSessionCallback interface. Supplying null will reset the callback. This is recommended to prevent memory leaks, e.g. when your activity holding the callback is paused.
